newsitem.title: INDIA: Increased consumer buying lifts India sugar prices.
newsitem.headline: Increased consumer buying lifts India sugar prices.

text.p: Increased consumer buying lifted Indian sugar prices on Tuesday, dealers said.
In the ready delivery sugar S-30 moved up by 10 rupees to 1,280/1,310 rupees per quintal while M-30 rose by 16/20 rupees to 1,315/1,376 rupees per quintal.

On Monday, sugar S-30 was up by 5/25 rupees per quintal while M-30 was up by 10/20 rupees per quintal. Bulk consumers remained active buyers at mill level amid rising hot weather in the country which lifted prices of a sugar mill delivery by five rupees at 1,215/1,230 rupees per quintal. Mill delivery was up by 10/20 rupees per quintal on Monday.
Overall sentiments was firm at the close of the session.
